MemberSignature.Value: public void Clone (out System.Runtime.InteropServices.UCOMIStream ppstm);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clone([out] class System.Runtime.InteropServices.UCOMIStream& ppstm) cil managed
Public Sub Clone (ByRef ppstm As UCOMIStream)
public: void Clone([Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::Runtime::InteropServices::UCOMIStream ^ % ppstm);
abstract member Clone : -> unit

Docs.param: On successful return, contains the new stream object.
Docs.summary: Creates a new stream object with its own seek pointer that references the same bytes as the original stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::Clone` in the MSDN library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Commit (int grfCommitFlags);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Commit(int32 grfCommitFlags) cil managed
Public Sub Commit (grfCommitFlags As Integer)
public: void Commit(int grfCommitFlags);
abstract member Commit : int -> unit

Docs.param: Controls how the changes for the stream object are committed.
Docs.summary: Ensures that any changes made to a stream object open in transacted mode are reflected in the parent storage.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::Commit` in the MSDN library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Runtime.InteropServices.UCOMIStream pstm, long cb, IntPtr pcbRead, IntPtr pcbWritten);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.UCOMIStream pstm, int64 cb, native int pcbRead, native int pcbWritten) cil managed
Public Sub CopyTo (pstm As UCOMIStream, cb As Long, pcbRead As IntPtr, pcbWritten As IntPtr)
public: void CopyTo(System::Runtime::InteropServices::UCOMIStream ^ pstm, long cb, IntPtr pcbRead, IntPtr pcbWritten);
abstract member CopyTo : System.Runtime.InteropServices.UCOMIStream * int64 * nativeint * nativeint -> unit

Docs.param: Reference to the destination stream.
The number of bytes to copy from the source stream.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes read from the source.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes written to the destination.
Docs.summary: Copies a specified number of bytes from the current seek pointer in the stream to the current seek pointer in another stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::CopyTo` in the MSDN library.

Docs.param: The byte offset for the beginning of the range.
The length of the range, in bytes, to restrict.
The requested restrictions on accessing the range.
Docs.summary: Restricts access to a specified range of bytes in the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::LockRegion` in the MSDN library.

Docs.param: On successful return, contains the data read frtom the stream.
The number of bytes to read from the stream object.
Pointer to a variable that receives the actual number of bytes read from the stream object.
Docs.summary: Reads a specified number of bytes from the stream object into memory starting at the current seek pointer.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Revert() cil managed
Public Sub Revert ()
public: void Revert();
abstract member Revert : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Discards all changes that have been made to a transacted stream since the last call.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::Revert` in the MSDN library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Seek (long dlibMove, int dwOrigin, IntPtr plibNewPosition);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Seek(int64 dlibMove, int32 dwOrigin, native int plibNewPosition) cil managed
Public Sub Seek (dlibMove As Long, dwOrigin As Integer, plibNewPosition As IntPtr)
public: void Seek(long dlibMove, int dwOrigin, IntPtr plibNewPosition);
abstract member Seek : int64 * int * nativeint -> unit

Docs.param: Displacement to add to .
Specifies the origin of the seek. The origin can be the beginning of the file, the current seek pointer, or the end of the file.
On successful return, contains the offset of the seek pointer from the beginning of the stream.
Docs.summary: Changes the seek pointer to a new location relative to the beginning of the stream, to the end of the stream, or to the current seek pointer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::Seek` in the MSDN library.

Docs.param: On successful return, contains a structure which describes this stream object.
Specifies some of the members in the structure that this method does not return, thus saving some memory allocation operations.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the structure for this stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `IStream::Stat` in the MSDN library.

Docs.param: The byte offset for the beginning of the range.
The length, in bytes, of the range to restrict.
The access restrictions previously placed on the range.
Docs.summary: Removes the access restriction on a range of bytes previously restricted with .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (byte[] pv, int cb, IntPtr pcbWritten);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(unsigned int8[] pv, int32 cb, native int pcbWritten) cil managed
Public Sub Write (pv As Byte(), cb As Integer, pcbWritten As IntPtr)
public: void Write(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ pv, int cb, IntPtr pcbWritten);
abstract member Write : byte[] * int * nativeint -> unit

Docs.param: Buffer to write this stream to.
The number of bytes to write into the stream.

On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes written to the stream object. The caller can set this pointer to , in which case this method does not provide the actual number of bytes written.
Docs.summary: Writes a specified number of bytes into the stream object starting at the current seek pointer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, please see the existing documentation for `ISequentialStream::Write` in the MSDN library.
